comments.commentBody: I doubt if Trump's supporters read the New York Times.

There is one truism that The Donald seems to understand that you newspapers and broadcasters have seemed to have forgotten: "All publicity is good publicity".

Now if you would stop publicizing his rantings and ravings he would be gone very quickly. On the other hand as a life long progressive/left leaning/liberal and registered democrat I would like him to win the Republican nomination since Bernie could beat him handily and Hillary could take some nice relaxing vacations before November 2016.
The self-crowned King Clown.
A severe case of Bi-polarism is being used by the Media to entice voters to go to the polls.

“Jindal, who has nothing,” he said. “Rick Perry — I mean Rick Perry, give me a break"

Even a broken clock is correct twice a day - those are the 2 for Donald Trump today.
This week in "How Many Thousands of Words Will the Times Use To Tell Us How Trump Is Not a Viable Candidate" we have background on his unorthodox "campaign."
A toddler would be completely honest too. And equally well-informed.

Robert Moses always hated the old and loved the automobile. He tore down much of old downtown Brooklyn, and of course, rammed the Brooklyn Queens Expressway through the borough, destroying still more housing. It was only when the lawyers and powerful citizens of Brooklyn Heights made the deal to put the BQE through their gardens that fronted on Furman Street was the neighborhood saved.

A decade after the Dodgers left, white flight was beginning to ebb, and red-lining, which condemned much the old Brooklyn to decay, was also becoming unacceptable. But by then, of course, the Dodgers were gone to greener [playing] fields.

If you view the US "system" as superior you are falling in a "visibility" trap. Everybody is talking about Europe, but this is just a PR access of USA and UK to hide their problems of public dept.
Furthermore for the majority of people, living in Europe 2015 allows by far more prosperity than in US- except millionaires. OK, let's not be unfair, above $100.000 income it may be better to live in the US with it's low taxes and many possibilities to lower them.
When I have finished earning my first million, maybe I will be go to the USA- or to Greece, where the millionaires can easily avoid to pay tax.

Seriously, you can take very much numbers. In fact, USA is a big melting pot between a developmental country like those in Middle- and South America, and the most richest people in the world.
If you take the welfare system, the insurancy system (we have managed "Obamacare" working since 1883 in Germany), the rate of suicides, the rate of analphebets, you can take many of these- Europe (and as well the southern European countries, are superior to US.)

Do you know the number 85? In 2011 this was the number of bullets used by German policmen (45 of which were warning shots). Compared, in 2011, only in "Harlem" 85 bullets were used by policmen in one month- ups- at one person ....

Superiority? Just difference, I would say. In fact every country could learn from the strong points of the other.

Dr K,

I read the links & think that your NBER paper on optimum currency areas demonstrates a good understanding of the EU, Euro Currency & ECB problem. If the EU participating countries could grasp the benefit of conforming to the factors of the OCA, they would be a lot better off. The EU could grow its economy and be monetarily/financially more stable if they would adapt the US system and leapfrog their charter to be more like the maturing United States. Even though we still have our problems in managing bubbles, we do have depositor guarantees in the banking system, & pension guarantees, etc. We have a few problems in managing our fiscal outlays for countercyclical safety net programs where some of our states don't treat their systems equally, but we are working on it. But on the big things such as transfers from rich states to poor states, we do it anyhow because we value the union and its strength which seems to have an overall benefit. Labor mobility, and eliminating rigid monetary standard rules are a necessity. If the EU works toward a more perfect union, they should be and will be formidable in global trade. Clearly they will be a strong competitor with the US, which if I remember correctly was a concern when it was first formed. I don't really see why it should be too hard to adapt their system to our Federal Reserve system, I would only recommend that we reinstate the Glass-Steagall banking act. We now know that its repeal was a mistake.
The entire country, not just the NYT, has become a propaganda machine for the Donald.  I agree with you 100%.
Entertainment, and it sells.
in case you looked, he's number one in the polls.......

What is this, the 26th NYT article about this guy in the past three days? He's a loud-mouth blowhard and a vulgar narcissist, he's exactly what the GOP deserves, and he doesn't have a snowball's chance of being nominated, much less elected. Anyone with half a brain knows all this. Why are you wasting the time of reporters and readers in rehashing this in a slightly different form every 15 minutes?
Me too!  Donald Trump is going to stir up the important issues.  Most of those bought off RHINO wimps with mush mouth will be seeing cross-eyed.  I will vote for Donald Trump!
Not only can this American wait for the Republican debates, I just gave my TV away.  I never looked at the former Republican debates and I am still alive and kicking.

I doubt he is going to lose any support at all. Nothing significant. He could even see an uptick.

I can't wait for the republican debates.
Yes, it was awful, but if you're a Republican it's OK to swiftboat a Democrat, but not one of your own. This is the Donald's sin.
Not to forget Max Cleland and now-Senator Tammy Duckworth.

Although I don't care for Trump one bit, I do credit him for calling John McCain out.  John McCain is not a war hero, he has used his POW status to pillage the country of all its good.  I agree with your comments 100%.

He's still trying to convince himself. His first audience is himself. If he really believed our war on Vietnam was a good thing he would not have to hear himself justify it 244/7/365.

PS - I'm also a Vietnam vet. I was a clerk who never fired a shot. I'm ashamed of our country for what we did there.
Holly, you're over forty years too late with your protests.  Just ask any American tourist or businessman today in Vietnam.

I believe Trump's criticism of John McCain's war record misses the point. How many Vietnamese women and children did John McCain kill during his heroic bombing missions? Does McCain know? or care? Are these dead or wounded Vietnamese civilians heroes too? 10 percent of Vietnam was sprayed with agent orange. Why did we do this? I think McCain should be ashamed of himself and ask forgiveness. Instead he seems to want to start a new war wherever and whenever possible.
Bravo. You said it best.
…not to mention the horrible "swift boating" of John Kerry who really is a decorated war hero by the vicious GOP.
And where was the outrage when the Republicans 'Swiftboated' John Kerry, and smeared Max Cleland??!!

The Republican outrage machine is very selective about whom they attack.

All Trump said is that he doesn't consider McCain a hero. He didn't say McCain was a coward or traitor. Just not a hero.

Where was the Republican outrage when Trump and others questioned whether Obama was born in the US? Even after Hawaii provided his birth
certificate?

Where was the outrage when others claimed Obama was secretly a Muslim?
And pro-Muslim terrorism?

And, recently, and most outrageously, that Obama was a "traitor" to the US
for reaching an agreement with Iran to control nuclear weapon development?

Surely, saying these things about Obama is a lot worse than denying someone was a hero.

Nice summation of what we never see about John McCain's pre-Senate life. Trump landed a K.O. with this remark and it's about time Republicans stop their hero worship of a stalwart warmonger with a past that's been scrubbed to only show a war hero story.
That said, I worry that Republican Party is glad Trump's around to make the other candidates look more reasonable, less insane.

I read an article a while back in ESPN magazine about why black boys didn't grow up playing baseball. The author, a black man if I remember correctly, said that, sadly, it was because baseball was a father-son game.  Sort of makes sense when you think about it, unfortunately.

I am so terribly disappointed in this new show.  After watching the first episode, I tortured myself by sitting through the second with hope that it would be an improvement over the first.  I was wrong.  The panel discussion on whether or not a hot dog is a sandwich was nothing short of juvenile and lacked anything even remotely funny.  Hannibal Buress is an incredibly sharp witted, talented comedian and writer.  Sadly none of his comedic chops are evident, and his new show is just a waste of time.  I hope for his sake that this venture does not set back a career on the rise.
The best comment I have seen here, today Phildo!

More entertainment, you mean? Palin, you say -- that has been, who has painted herself into a box?  Fortunately, there are not enough Trump/Christie/Palin lovers for them to survive.  Make a dint in the Hillary candidacy?  I promise you, with this side show, Hillary looks better than ever!  Imagine Donald Trump representing the U.S. on the international stage!  What a colossal embarrassment that would be!
Do you really think Trump would share the limelight with another blowhard like Christie or Palin?

Mr. Trump has a certain roguish charm that could captivate a sizable portion of the electorate. Do you really think all those Kardashian viewers and professional sports fans really care about the nuances of trade agreements, the ACA or foreign policy? They want to be entertained, and Trump does that better than any other candidate. And he knows it.

A Trump/Christie or Trump/Palin ticket will suck all the oxygen out of a Hillary candidacy. Remember the old advertising adage - "any publicity is good publicity."

I have absolutely no connection to the show. But I'm a film and movie geek from way back. I'm also a writer and I can tell just how hard it is to write something that good and that complicated with such simple language.

Tiger is Tiger Woods. He 's won 6 x more majors than Spieth, and approximately 12 x more professional tournaments. If you haven't heard of him there's plenty of information here on the web that you can check out.

I do wonder if Mr. Trump practices what he preaches. Are all the Trump employees citizens or legally able to work in the U.S.A. ?

I've worked in many kitchens in the NYC area and I can tell you that most are staffed with people that are not.

It seems that it would be impossible to amass $10 Billion Dollars in one lifetime by only hiring citizens and paying them legal wages, but it can be possible I suppose.

If you keep getting tax abatements like Mr. Trump.
I read the book, which I recommend. Can't wait for the movie!
Not sure what "Squeeee" means .... but think I agree!
Let's start a "Keep Hamilton" campaign! I know enough people who feel as you do. Maybe can start by presenting a petition outside the theater.

@ Futbolistavia , SF
Agree about Klinsi. It was best to free Dempsey up from the burden of being Captain. The German press had a field day beating up JK for that decision, and just about everything else since he took the helm of the USMT.
Of course, it's nothing but sour grapes...And they also had to eat their words when USA beat Germany in that 'friendly' game last month. I for one, took great delight in rubbing it in--- (in German!!!) on SPIEGEL Online....and I'm a DFB fan.
Time to go for the Gold ---- USA!!!

Over the years I have been one of the harshest critics of CD.
He played a good match yesterday but as Pete from Philly correctly points out it was against a vastly poor Cuba. They also had only 4 bench players left after 5 players had defected to the USA during this tournament.

JK did the USA team a big favor in stripping CD of his captaincy for the Gold Cup.
CD has not played this hard or been more productive for his country.

Just watched the end of the Mexico-CR match. Disgraceful leap by Peralta to get a PK. He should have been booked for simulation.
Actually he should not even have been on the pitch as his foul in the 113th minute was clearly a red card.

Hope Panama beats Mexico in the SF.
